bug.short_desc: 3 misbehaviours/bugs of native scrollbars of qx.ui.form.TextArea

long_desc.thetext:
Looking at following example: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#widget~TextField.html
1. example textarea with wrap:
if you type in characters on line 1 until you reach the end of the line, the line wraps to the next line. It is okay until it comes to the end of the third line. Then it inserts the vertical native scrollbar. This should not have happened until in the end of the FOURTH line.
2. example textarea with no wrap: the same happens here as in ex 1. but here it is correct BECAUSE of no wrap it shall insert a native horizontal scrollbar. It does not activate the vertical scrollbar, which is correct. The problem here is that the third line is NOT accessible! This happens when the horizontal scrollbar at any line is activated.
But if it is done on line 3 then the vertical scrollbar also is activated!! This is wrong because there is NO WRAP! The vertical scrollbar shall be activated only if one more line has been added...
Which browser / OS do you use? I haven't seen any of your descriptions on OSX lion with Chrome.
Daniel, could you check that on your system and report back if you can reproduce it?
